title_trans: Prakaran 150: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહું દેશ કાનમમાં એક ઈટોલું ગામ 
ભક્ત ભલા કણબી કુળે જાણો જીજીભાઈ નામ
gujarati.context: I say a country is in my ear, it's just a small village; A devotee has taken the name Gijibhai in his family.

gujarati.couplet:
સતસંગમાં શિરોમણિ વળી હરિમાં ઘણું હેત 
અચળ કીધો આશરો સોંપી તન મન ધન સમેત
gujarati.context: In the company of the noble-minded, one is blessed with great prosperity; even one's thoughts are filled with wealth and good fortune.

gujarati.couplet:
આયુષ ખૂટ્યે આવિયો ભાઈ એના દેહનો અંત 
તેને આવ્યા તેડવા નિજ ભક્ત જાણી ભગવંત
gujarati.context: The mortal's life has ended, the body is no more; now he has gone to God, known by his own devotion.

gujarati.couplet:
નિજ સખા બહુ સંત સાથે મોટા મોટા મુનિરાજ 
સુવર્ણમય રથ માંઇ બેસી પધાર્યા મહારાજ
gujarati.context: In the presence of true friends and great saints, one achieves grandeur; seated on a golden chariot, one is elevated to royal status.

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યા અર્ધ રાત્યે અવિનાશ થયો ગામમાં બહુ પ્રકાશ 
એક દ્વિજભક્ત બાપુભાઈ છોડ્યો રથ તેના ફળી માંઇ
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a person who has arrived at the threshold of spiritual enlightenment in the morning, having traversed the darkness of ignorance and gained great insight in his village. He is now ready to share his wisdom with others, having cultivated inner light through devotion.

gujarati.couplet:
જાગી લાગિયા બાપુજી પાય નીર્ખી નાથને તૃપ્ત ન થાય 
કહે થયો કૃતારથ આજ તમે ઘેર પધાર્યા મહારાજ
gujarati.context: A child's worries seem to disappear when their father is present, but if one doesn't please the king, they will not be satisfied. Today's deed was spoken as a royal command, so you should fulfill it, great king.

gujarati.couplet:
હવે રહો રાજી થઈ નાથ એમ કહે ઊભો જોડી હાથ 
પછી બોલિયા શ્રીમહારાજ અમે આવ્યા જીજીભાઈ કાજ
gujarati.context: Now the matter is settled, the couple's hands are tied; Later, we'll tell our king that we've come to claim our rightful share.

gujarati.couplet:
એને તેડી જાશું આજ અમે સત્ય માનો બાપુભાઈ તમે 
ત્યારે બોલ્યા બાપુભાઈ એમ એને મેલી જાઓ કહીએ કેમ
gujarati.context: Today, I will take you away, believing in the truth of father's words; then Father Bapubhai said this, go and unite them, asking why.

gujarati.couplet:
પણ સત્સંગમાં એહ જેવા બીજા નથી શિખામણ્ય દેવા 
ત્યારે નાથ કહે નહિ લૈયે લેશું એના બળધને તૈયે
gujarati.context: In good company, one can't learn anything new; then there's no need to ask, just follow the leader's lead.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બોલ્યા બાપુ હરિજન પ્રભુ એવું શિયું એનું પુણ્ય 
ત્યારે શ્રીહરિ કહે સંત અર્થે જુત્યોતો એ રસોઈને રથે
gujarati.context: When someone is born as a low-caste person, it's due to their past karma; and when they're born again, they take on the role of a saint to purify themselves.

gujarati.couplet:
માટે લઈ જાશું એને આજ એમ કહી પધાર્યા મહારાજ 
પછે બાપુભાઈ તેહ પળે ગયો જીજીભાઈને પાસળે
gujarati.context: I will take it now, as You said, O great king; later, Bapubhai will take it in his time and pass it on to the grandchildren.

gujarati.couplet:
કહે હમણાં પધાર્યાતા નાથ બહુ સંત હતા હરિ સાથ 
તે તો તેડવા આવ્યાતા તમને પણ રાખી ગયા કહ્યું અમને
gujarati.context: We were blessed to have been accompanied by many saints with God, but they came and went, leaving us with only their words of wisdom.

gujarati.couplet:
પણ એ વાત સાચી તો મળે જાયે બળદ તમારા પાસળે 
પછી કરી દીવો જોયું જઈ ત્યાં તો બળધિયાના પ્રાણ નઈ
gujarati.context: If the truth be told, you'll find it at your doorstep; only then will the lamp of hope shine bright and fill your life with breath.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સહુને તેડી કરી વાત જે દીઠીતી નજરે સાક્ષાત્ 
તેહ સાંભળી આશ્ચર્ય પામ્યાં ધન્ય સ્વામી કહી શીશ નામ્યાં
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

After having a conversation, it became clear that he was the one; I was amazed and grateful to have my dear lord's company named.

gujarati.couplet:
કહે પરચો થયો છે આ ભારી એમ કહેવા લાગ્યાં નરનારી 
વળી વાત બીજી એક કહું તમે સાંભળજ્યો જન સહુ
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet says that this worldly burden is heavy, and it seems like men and women will go on talking about it; I'll say something else, listen carefully, my fellow human being.

gujarati.couplet:
કાનમમાં માંગરોળ ગામે કણબી ભક્ત ત્યાં બેચર નામે 
કરે ખેતી તે નિર્વાહ કાજ મુખે ભજે સ્વામી શ્રીમહારાજ
gujarati.context: In one's own home, a true devotee is like an orphan; he cultivates the land but maintains it for God alone.

gujarati.couplet:
પાળે વ્રત પ્રતિમામાં પ્રીત ખેતીવાડીમાં ન બેસે ચિત્ત 
ત્યારે સરકારે કહ્યું બોલાવી ભર્ય રૂપૈયા અમને લાવી
gujarati.context: The heart is devoted to the Lord's love, not the worldly attachment; then only can one receive the divine call and be taken back by the Lord.

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહીને બેસાર્યો તર્ત આપે ક્યાંથી ગાંઠે નહિ ગર્થ 
બેઠાં વીતી ગયા બેઉ દન લેવા દીધું નહિ જળ અન્ન
gujarati.context:
As one settles down, the heart becomes still; you should not stir up worries from anywhere.

Years have passed like two fingers, and I haven't grasped even a drop of water or food.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બેચરે કર્યો વિચાર પ્રભુ કેમ ઉતારશો પાર 
મારે તો બળ એક તમારું બીજો નથી તમ વિના વારું
gujarati.context: When I pondered my fate, the Lord took a step; He gave me strength, and for another, there was no war.

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહેતાં પધાર્યા મહારાજ નિજ જન છોડાવવા કાજ 
દેખી દુષ્ટ ગયા દલે ડરી ભાંગી બેડી તેડી ચાલ્યા હરિ
gujarati.context: The king's words are a warning to his subjects, telling them that those who are selfish and neglect their duties will be punished. Those who were wicked and fearless have already met their end, and now the king is moving forward with justice.

gujarati.couplet:
લઈ સર્વે એનો જે સમાજ પહોંચાડ્યો જ્યાં બીજાનું રાજ 
સરવે ઝખ મારી રહ્યા જોઈ કેડ્યે આવી શક્યા નહિ કોઈ
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet describes a society where everyone is equal, yet someone's power has taken over and nobody can stop it from happening. The speaker laments that their warnings have been ignored and nothing can change the course of events now.

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરી અલૌકિક કાજ પછી પધાર્યા ત્યાંથી મહારાજ 
વળી વાત કહું એક સારી સુણો સર્વે છે ચમતકારી
gujarati.context: This couplet describes a unique deed that was done with great difficulty and effort, only to be recognized as extraordinary by others. The speaker shares a good story, which is impressive to everyone.

gujarati.couplet:
એક કાનમે કરાલી ગામ બહુ ભક્ત વસે એહ ઠામ 
અતિ હેત પ્રીત્યનો નહિ પાર એવા હરિજન નરનાર્ય
gujarati.context: One town is filled with devotees, and many saints reside here; but those who have no devotion to their beloved ones cannot cross over, like the untouchable Harijans, men and women.

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં પરચા થયા છે બહુ લખું કેટલા કેટલા કહું 
અંતકાળે તજે જન તન આવે તેડવા શ્રી ભગવન
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

My heart is filled with numerous thoughts, I'll write down how many; In the end, it's only the Lord who knows and understands.

gujarati.couplet:
રથ વેલ્ય વિમાન ને વાજિ બેસી જાય તે પર થઈ રાજી 
એવા પરચા થાય છે લાખું તે તો કેટલાક કહી દાખું
gujarati.context: One can occupy the position on top, but it takes a great deal of effort to reach there; and only a few know how to express their emotions with such simplicity.

gujarati.couplet:
પણ કહું વાત એક વળી સર્વે જન લેજ્યો તે સાંભળી 
એક પાટીદાર નાનોભાઈ થાય દુઃખી મંદવાડ માંઇ
gujarati.context: When something is said, everyone listens; even a small child who cries in distress will be heard.

gujarati.couplet:
તજ્યું ખાવું પીવું જળ અન્ન તેને વીતી ગયા બહુ દન 
જે જે જોવા આવે જન પાસ તેને નહિ એના જીવ્યાની આશ
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

Life's necessities, such as food and water, are fleeting and limited; what we truly seek is companionship with others to give our life meaning.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી એક દાડે એમ થયું નાડી પ્રાણાદિ કાંઈ ન રહ્યું 
પછી સંબંધી સર્વે ત્યાં મળી કાઢો કાઢો કહે વળી વળી
gujarati.context: After a lifetime of effort, nothing remains; afterwards, all connections come together, saying "goodbye" and "hello" again.

gujarati.couplet:
થયાં તૈયાર લઈ સમાજ ત્યારે પધાર્યા શ્રીમહારાજ 
લાવ્યા રથ વેલ્ય ને વિમાન આવ્યા સંત ભેળા ભગવાન
gujarati.context: Prepared to be ready when called upon by society, then the King of Kings has been reached; taking the chariot of love to heaven, arrived at the stage where the saint has mixed with God.

gujarati.couplet:
સહુ જનને દર્શન થયાં કોઈ દર્શન વિના ન રહ્યાં 
જોઈ જન થયા છે મગન કહે ભલે આવ્યા ભગવન
gujarati.context: When one sees God, they are transformed; without seeing Him, one cannot remain. It is said that even a lowly person who has seen God can say that they have been blessed by the divine.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બોલિયા શ્રીમહારાજ અમે આવ્યા નાનાભાઈ કાજ 
તેને તેડી લઈ જાવાતા સાથ પણ મેલી જાશું કહે નાથ
gujarati.context: When we were young and foolish, I came with a small brother's claim; though my rival is ahead, I won't give up, I'll still prevail.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાનાને કહે મહારાજ તને તેડી નહિ જાઈએ આજ 
માટે અન્ન જળ હવે લેજ્યે સુખે સ્વામિનારાયણ કહેજ્યે
gujarati.context: When small troubles come, I say to the King, "Don't leave me today." Therefore, take the bread, water and now also say, "Swaminarayan is happy."

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહી ચાલ્યા ભગવન જગજીવન જીવાડી જન 
જોઈ આશ્ચર્ય પામિયાં સહુ કહે વાત આ તો મોટી બહુ
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

God, I am amazed by this life; it's a big deal, you know what I mean?

gujarati.couplet:
આથી પર્ચો બીજો કિયો કહીએ સહુ વિચારી જુવોને હૈયે 
વળી વાત કહું બીજી એક સુણો સામર્થિ હરિની વિશેક
gujarati.context: Don't think about others' thoughts, ponder your own soul; Share the story of another, one more, of God's majesty, so great and unique.

gujarati.couplet:
એક ભક્ત છે જેઠિયો બાળ તેના દેહનો આવિયો કાળ 
થયો માંદો ને ન બોલે મુખ તેને જોઈને કહે વિમુખ
gujarati.context: A devotee is like a child, whose body is worn out by time; their face may be pale and silent, but still they look up to God with hope.

gujarati.couplet:
કહે આને તો વળગ્યું ઝોડ શું જોઈ રહ્યા કરોને ધ્રોડ 
ત્યારે બોલિયો છે એનો તાત એવી કરશો મા કોઈ વાત
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Whatever is destined to happen will unfold; don't worry about it, just accept what's meant to be.

gujarati.couplet:
મરે જીવે તેનું નહિ કાંય પણ ભુવા પાસે ન જવાય 
થાશે હરિનું ગમતું હશે તેનો શીદને કરવો સંશે
gujarati.context: As one's life comes to an end, they'll not go anywhere else; however, their soul will remain with the Lord.

gujarati.couplet:
એહ વાત સુણી નહિ કાન ત્યાં તો પધારિયા ભગવાન 
એક બાઈ હતી હરિજન દીધાં આવી તેને દરશન
gujarati.context: If one doesn't listen to the truth, then only God will guide them; a lowly woman was led to her divine revelation.

gujarati.couplet:
બાઈ પાય લાગી જોડી હાથ કહે ક્યાંથી પધારિયા નાથ 
કહે નાથ આવ્યા અમે આજ જેઠિયાને તેડવાને કાજ
gujarati.context: The sister has clasped my hand, saying "Where have we come from?" and I replied that we had arrived today to settle scores with the elder brother and his father-in-law.

gujarati.couplet:
પણ મેલી જાશું આજ એને કહેજ્યે વાત જઈને તું તેને 
તેનું આપીએ તને એંધાણ આપ્યું કુંકુમ અલૌકિ જાણ્ય
gujarati.context: I will give everything to him today, and as he leaves, you'll tell the story. He received from me the fragrance of musk and an unforgettable understanding.

gujarati.couplet:
કરજ્યે ચાંદલો આનો તું જઈ સ્વામિનારાયણ નામ લઈ 
બેઠો થઈને બોલશે બાળ એમ કહીને ચાલ્યા દયાળ
gujarati.context: The couplet is about a person's soul (chandalo) going to God Swaminarayan, taking His name along the way, as if guided by an inner voice or intuition (bolo).

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બાઈ આવી તેને પાસ કહ્યું આવ્યા હતા અવિનાશ 
આપ્યું કુંકુમ ચાંદલો કરવા કહ્યું નથી જેઠિયાને મરવા
gujarati.context:
After the bride arrived, I got her in my possession, and it was forever; 
I would have made perfume with saffron, but I didn't get a chance to make Jeetha die.

gujarati.couplet:
પ્રભુ પધાર્યા હતા સાક્ષાત કહી સરવે મુજને વાત 
સહુ સાંભળી ચકિત થયાં ધન્ય ધન્ય પ્રભુ કહે રહ્યાં
gujarati.context: God had accepted our prayers directly, without even asking us to speak; Our hearts are overwhelmed with gratitude, God is saying thanks and again thanks.

gujarati.couplet:
દીઠું કુંકુમ અલૌકિ એહ થયો તર્ત બેઠો જેઠો તેહ 
મળી વાત કહી હરિજને થયો પરચો એ માનિયું મને
gujarati.context: This couplet expresses the beauty of a rare and precious pearl, comparing it to a moment of divine connection with God, saying that even if one's words are rejected, they should still share their thoughts with Him.

gujarati.couplet:
વળી એક વારતા અનુપ સહુ સાંભળજ્યો સુખરૂપ 
એહ દેશ માંયે રણુગામ ત્યાં જોગી પ્રભાતગર નામ
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Enjoyment comes when one meets their true friend, and that's where happiness resides; in this country, there's a town called Jogipraba.

gujarati.couplet:
સહુ જાણે એ મોટો છે સિદ્ધ રાજા પ્રજા માંહિ તે પ્રસિદ્ધ 
તેણે સુણી સંતની વારતા જાણ્યા સ્વામીને કલ્યાણ કરતા
gujarati.context: A great soul is one who has achieved spiritual enlightenment, renowned among people; such a person listens to the teachings of saints and brings about salvation for others through their own self-realization.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી તજી સંન્યાસીની રીત્ય કરી પ્રકટ પ્રભુજી શું પ્રીત્ય 
એમ કરતાં વીત્યા બહુ દન અવધ્યે ત્યાર થયા તજવા તન
gujarati.context: After renouncing worldly desires, what's the purpose of worshipping the Lord; countless days passed in vain, only to realize one's own impermanence later on.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે તેડવા આવ્યા મહારાજ લાવ્યા બહુ વિમાન બાવા કાજ 
આવી કંઠમાં આરોપ્યો હાર આપ્યો તોરો કહ્યું થાઓ ત્યાર
gujarati.context: The king arrived with many claims, but ultimately lost the war. He was defeated and brought to justice, fulfilling his destiny.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બાવોજી બેઠા વિમાન તેડી ચાલ્યા પોત્યે ભગવાન 
આપ્યો હતો હાર તોરો જેહ રહ્યો પ્રકટ કોટમાં તેહ
gujarati.context: After crossing the ocean of life, one finally reaches their Lord; and if they have not fallen into sin, they remain steadfast in the Lord's abode.

gujarati.couplet:
સહુ દેખીને પામ્યા આશ્ચર્જ કહે જુવો આ તોરો ને સ્રજ 
આ તો અલૌકિક વાત બહુ એમ કહે જન મળી સહુ
gujarati.context: When seen with surprise and astonishment, I say behold this incredible creation; it's a heavenly matter, people gather to witness it.

gujarati.couplet:
આ તો પ્રતાપ મહારાજ તણો સ્વામી સહજાનંદજીનો ઘણો 
એમ પરચા બહુ બહુ થાય તે નિષ્કુળાનંદે ન લખાય
gujarati.context:
The summary is:

He who has the power of a great king, has also many Swamis like Sahajanandji; but such a one's joy cannot be written down.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahu desh Kānammā, ek Īṭolu gām; <RHYME_1>
Bhakta bhalā kaṇabī kuḷe, jāṇo Jījībhāī nām.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: In a distant land, there's a village called Ek Itol; the devotee is blessed with good sight to see Jijibhai's name.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangmā shiromaṇi, vaḷī Harimā ghaṇu het; <RHYME_2>
Achaḷ kīdho āsharo, sopī tan man dhan samet.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: In the presence of a true friend, even the divine is attainable through their company. A true friend's words are like nectar that fills one's heart with joy and wealth.

transliteration.couplet:
Āyuṣh khūṭye āviyo, bhāī enā dehno ant; <RHYME_3>
Tene āvyā teḍavā, nij bhakta jāṇī Bhagwant.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: One's life is short-lived on earth, and the body is impermanent. One should realize one's true nature as a devotee of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Nij sakhā bahu sant sāthe, moṭā moṭā munirāj; <RHYME_4>
Suvarṇamay rath māi, besī padhāryā Mahārāj.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: A person is at peace with their own kin and friends, while also having a deep connection with the divine; they ride on the chariot of golden wisdom, led by Lord Maharaj.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā ardh rātye Avināsh, thayo gāmmā bahu prakāsh; <RHYME_5>
Ek dvij-bhakta Bāpubhāī, chhoḍyo rath tenā faḷī māi.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: In the evening twilight, there's no end to the darkness; but for a devotee like me, even death is radiant with divine light.

transliteration.couplet:
Jāgī lāgiyā bāpujī pāy, nīrkhī Nāthane tṛupt na thāy; <RHYME_6>
Kahe thayo kṛutārath āj, tame gher padhāryā Mahārāj.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The Lord's mercy is always available to those who seek it, and one should not delay in seeking it. It is said that only today can one get the Lord's protection, so one must hasten towards it.

transliteration.couplet:
Have raho rājī thaī Nāth, em kahe ūbho joḍī hāth; <RHYME_7>
Pachhī boliyā Shrī Mahārāj, ame āvyā Jījībhāī kāj.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The humble person thinks of God as their protector, who holds their hand; they also speak the truth to Sri Maharaj and fulfill the duties of Jiiji's family.

transliteration.couplet:
Ene teḍī jāshu āj ame, satya māno Bāpubhāī tame; <RHYME_8>
Tyāre bolyā Bāpubhāī em, ene melī jāo kahīe kem.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context:
Truthfulness is considered a virtue today as it was in the past, and I swear by the oath of God; 
I will tell you a story, listen to me, where love has gone astray somewhere.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṇ satsangmā eh jevā, bījā nathī shikhāmaṇya devā; <RHYME_9>
Tyāre Nāth kahe nahi laiye, leshu enā baḷadhane taiye.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: In the presence of divine wisdom, one should not sow seeds that will only wither away; rather, one should harvest the fruits of good deeds for oneself.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre bolyā bāpu harijan, Prabhu evu shiyu enu puṇya; <RHYME_10>
Tyāre Shrīhari kahe sant arthe, jutyoto e rasoīne rathe.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: A devotee's soul is blessed by the Lord, earning great merit. The Lord Himself speaks to a saintly soul in the still of night, filling their heart with love.

transliteration.couplet:
Māṭe laī jāshu ene āj, em kahī padhāryā Mahārāj; <RHYME_11>
Pachhe Bāpubhāī teh paḷe, gayo Jījībhāīne pāsaḷe.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: Today's worry is like yesterday's tale, told to the King; behind is the past, and ahead lies the future's path.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe hamaṇā padhāryātā Nāth, bahu sant hatā Hari sāth; <RHYME_12>
Te to teḍavā āvyātā tamane, paṇ rākhī gayā kahyu amane.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context:
The Lord guides those who are devoted and humble, as many saints have lost their way while accompanying God.

God's presence is felt when one surrenders to Him, and only then can one truly find peace.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṇ e vāt sāchī to maḷe, jāye baḷad tamārā pāsaḷe; <RHYME_13>
Pachhī karī dīvo joyu jaī, tyā to baḷadhiyānā prāṇ naī.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: The truth is like the wind that blows freely, and it's not bound by anyone's control. Even if you try to capture it, your breath will be taken away in vain.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sahune teḍī karī vāt, je dīṭhītī najare sākṣhāt; <RHYME_14>
Teh sāmbhaḷī āshcharya pāmyā, dhanya Swāmī kahī shīsh nāmyā.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The winds of fate blow gently, revealing one's true nature in the mirror of life. One's remarkable accomplishments and Lord's blessings are revealed to those who deserve it.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: Summary: Someone's fate is sealed, whether they're a man or woman; one seed of destiny can sprout into a tree that encompasses the entire universe.

transliteration.couplet:
Kānammā Māngaroḷ gāme, kaṇabī bhakta tyā Bechar nāme; <RHYME_16>
Kare khetī te nirvāh kāj, mukhe bhaje Swāmī Shrī Mahārāj.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: In a village, the devotee is like a blind person, not knowing anything; he only serves and worships God with devotion. His soul is absorbed in serving and chanting Lord Shri Maharaj's name.

transliteration.couplet:

Tyāre sarakāre kahyu bolāvī, bharya rūpaiyā amane lāvī.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The couplet expresses the joy and enthusiasm of a newlywed couple (Pāḷe vrat pratimāmā prīt), but notes that their minds are not yet free from worldly worries.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that some people are always busy with others' matters, but they themselves lack harmony in their own lives. Similarly, just as a fire is extinguished without fuel, a person's efforts go unfulfilled without proper support or resources.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre Bechare karyo vichār, Prabhu kem utārasho pār; <RHYME_19>
Māre to baḷ ek tamāru, bījo nathī tam vinā vāru.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The poor and helpless should consider their thoughts, as the Lord will lift them up from the depth; Just like a mango tree grows with its roots, one's reputation grows without any fault.

transliteration.couplet:

Dekhī duṣhṭa gayā dale ḍarī, bhāngī beḍī teḍī chālyā Hari.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The Lord says, "Let others take care of their own affairs; I have my own duties to attend to."

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: In a chaotic society where everyone is equal, the true rulers are those who sow good deeds. Even in times of crisis, those who have done wrong cannot escape their karma.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The king of the universe is doing a unique task that only he can accomplish; listen carefully to this amazing wonder.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A person who has no self-respect will settle in any kind of village or home. One who is excessively attached to worldly love cannot attain divine love.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A woman's beauty is fleeting and fragile, like a bunch of flowers that wither quickly; but in the end, it's only her devotion to God that matters. Ultimately, it's only one's love for God that counts, not worldly attractions.

transliteration.couplet:
Rath velya vimān ne vāji, besī jāy te par thaī rājī; <RHYME_25>

transliteration.context: A person's life journey is compared to a chariot ride (Rath velya), and one should be content with their destination (besī jāy). The path to this destination may have its challenges, but ultimately it is up to us to find meaning in our experiences.

transliteration.couplet:

Ek Pāṭīdār Nānobhāī, thāy dukhī mandavāḍ māi.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: A single grain of rice can fill everyone's hunger, and even the greatest king can be brought down by poverty;

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A person's hard-earned wealth is like a tree that's been watered and nourished, and their generosity is the fruit of that labor. However, in old age, they may not have enough to sustain themselves, leaving only ashes.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī ek dāḍe em thayu, nāḍī prāṇādi kāī na rahyu; <RHYME_28>
Pachhī sambandhī sarve tyā maḷī, kāḍho kāḍho kahe vaḷī vaḷī.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context:
Life's journey is like a thread of dharma, it weaves through all our moments; and as we walk, all our thoughts and emotions are connected in this tapestry.

In relationships, each person's actions and words are intertwined like the threads of a fabric, influencing one another.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: In a well-organized community, Sri Maharaj is revered and respected; Just as a magnificent chariot carries the Lord, a peaceful soul carries God within.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The divine encounter is the real meeting, and without it, there's no meeting at all. The one who has encountered God does not have to seek anything else from Him.

transliteration.context: The couplet is a prayer to Lord Shri Mahārāj, asking for his guidance and protection. It seeks His presence and blessings in times of need.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The king (Maharaj) says that even a small portion is not enough for today, and I will not leave without consuming the anna (rice); Lord Swaminarayan says to eat with joy.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The Lord goes where he pleases, and the mortal's life is but a fleeting moment. The wonders one experiences are beyond comprehension, like a lot of cotton candy in the air.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
The couplet speaks about the importance of self-reflection and understanding one's own abilities, rather than seeking external opinions or validation.

A single seed can produce a vast tree, listen to your inner strength and guidance from God is what matters most.

Their love will flourish like a lotus in water, growing more beautiful and vibrant over time.

transliteration.couplet:
Sahu dekhīne pāmyā āshcharja, kahe juvo ā toro ne sraja; <RHYME_50>
Ā to alaukik vāt bahu, em kahe jan maḷī sahu.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: When a virtuous person's deeds are observed, the world becomes sacred; they themselves become sacred.

transliteration.couplet:
Ā to pratāp Mahārāj taṇo, Swāmī Sahajānandjīno ghaṇo; <RHYME_51>
Em parachā bahu bahu thāy, te Niṣhkuḷānande na lakhāy.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context: The great Mahārāj and Swāmī Sahajānandji are eternal; their divine presence is forever accessible. Many may desire to see them, but few can truly behold their beauty.
